channel.title: THIS IS AWESOME! New GM 8.1 Standard 3D Tech and Lighting Test
channel.description:
Ok so last night I purchased GameMaker 8.1 Standard (The latest Game Maker version) and I have been noticing that it is crazy fast and amazing. Now it has the support of 3D models and has a completely new 3D engine. Check this out:
I created this today for a 3D Speed Test as well as a 3D Lighting Test. Press 1-7 to see the different lighting affects admire the speed and the beauty of the 3D models =)
Download: http://up.ht/lQZUJb
Images: Lighting Effects Set To 1 [IMG]http://i344.photobucket.com/albums/p348/tekidder_2008/fellas/1.jpg[/img]
Lighting Effects Set To 7 [IMG]http://i344.photobucket.com/albums/p348/tekidder_2008/fellas/2.jpg[/img]

item.title: THIS IS AWESOME! New GM 8.1 Standard 3D Tech and Lighting Test
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

That wood texture is horrendous. That is a pretty nice lighting system you got there though.

Read full topic

item.title: THIS IS AWESOME! New GM 8.1 Standard 3D Tech and Lighting Test
item.dc:creator: @GML_Programmer GML Programmer
item.description:
@GML_Programmer wrote:

CoonHunter:

Any such thing as “else if” at all? Sorry, been since GM 5.0 since I even touched it lol.

well you can do this:

IF touched button THEN
open door
ELSE
PRINT “Press the button to open the door”
ENDIF

or

IF touched button THEN
open door
ELSE
IF button not touched THEN
PRINT “Press the button to open the door”
ENDIF

Read full topic

item.source: THIS IS AWESOME! New GM 8.1 Standard 3D Tech and Lighting Test

item.title: THIS IS AWESOME! New GM 8.1 Standard 3D Tech and Lighting Test
item.dc:creator: @GML_Programmer GML Programmer
item.description:
@GML_Programmer wrote:

Lol yeah that too. But I like game maker they also changed the way you program. Here is the source for the 3D lighting test:

//Light Showcase

//Choose better display mode
if check display mode(1024,768,32)=1
 set display mode 1024,768,32
else
 if check display mode(1024,768,16)=1
  set display mode 1024,768,16
 endif
endif

//Standard Setup Code for all examples
sync on : sync rate 0 : backdrop off
set text font "arial" : set text size 16
set text to bold : set text transparent

//Load Hero music
load music "music\hero.mp3",1 : loop music 1

//User prompt
sync : center text screen width()/2,screen height()/2,"LOADING" : sync

//Load Statue Model
set normalization on
load object "models\statue.x",1
load image "models\bumpmap.bmp",1
xrotate object 1,270 : fix object pivot 1
set light mapping on 1,1
set object specular 1,0
rotate object 1,0,0,0

//Load room
load object "world\room.x",2
xrotate object 2,270 : fix object pivot 2
set object specular 2,0
rotate object 2,0,0,0

//Set dynamic light zero
hide light 0

//Create pixie lights and dots
for l=1 to 7
 make light l
 set point light l,0,0,0
 set light range l,2000
 make object sphere 2+l,50 : ghost object on 2+l
 if l>1 then hide light l : hide object 2+l
next l

//Main loop
desc$="Pixie Lights (Select keys 1-7)"
do

//Control light visibility
k$=inkey$()
if k$>="1" and k$<="7"
 if keypress=0
  keypress=1
  li=1+(asc(k$)-asc("1"))
  if light visible(li)=1
   hide light li : hide object 2+li
  else
   show light li : show object 2+li
  endif
  c#=wrapvalue(180+(a#+(li*85)))
 endif
else
 keypress=0
endif

//Rotate around model
a#=wrapvalue(a#+0.5)
b#=wrapvalue(b#+0.2)
c#=wrapvalue(c#+0.05)
x#=cos(c#)*250.0
z#=sin(c#)*300.0
position light 0,x#,150,z#
position camera x#,100,z#
point camera 0,150,0

//Rotate lights around model
for l=1 to 7
 x#=cos(a#+(l*85))*300.0
 z#=sin(a#+(l*85))*150.0
 position light l,x#,100+(sin(b#)*100),z#
 position object 2+l,x#,100+(sin(b#)*100),z#
next l

//Alter light colours over time
leva#=wrapvalue(leva#+0.01)
level#=cos(leva#)
for l=1 to 7
 col=127.0+(127.0*level#)
 rev=col*-1
 if l=1 then color light l,col,rev,rev
 if l=2 then color light l,128,col,128
 if l=3 then color light l,255,255,col*2
 if l=4 then color light l,col,rev,col
 if l=5 then color light l,col,col,col
 if l=6 then color light l,500,500,500
 if l=7 then color light l,rev*3,rev*3,rev*3
next l

//Show Framerate
text 20,screen height()-40,desc$
fps$="Fps: "+str$(screen fps())
text screen width()-20-text width(fps$),screen height()-40,fps$

//update
sync

//end loop
loop

Read full topic
item.source: THIS IS AWESOME! New GM 8.1 Standard 3D Tech and Lighting Test

item.title: THIS IS AWESOME! New GM 8.1 Standard 3D Tech and Lighting Test
item.dc:creator: @GML_Programmer GML Programmer
item.description:
@GML_Programmer wrote:

Lol yeah I get you. Game Maker was originally intended for 2D games only. But with the high demand of others wanting to make 3D games Mike Overmars (The creator of game maker) finally gave in. Now you can get a high quality product for a low price. Unlike most programs (besides unity) that cost anywhere from $60-$250+

Read full topic

Now its smooth and well composed.
